The BCCI shared pictures from his visit on social media and wrote, "Always all ears when the great @mahi7781 talks!" Team India wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant also shared a picture with Dhoni.

175.title: Pics of protesters sleeping on sofa, taking shower at SL President's house go viral
175.article_body: Pictures of protesters sleeping on sofa, taking shower, storming the kitchen and using gym equipment at Sri Lanka President Gotabaya Rajapaksa's official residence have gone viral. Rajapaksa ran away after the protesters overran his palace in the country's capital, Colombo. This comes amid the worsening economic crisis in the country.

176.title: Even parents don't ask me so much about marriage than public: Sonakshi
176.article_body: Actress Sonakshi Sinha, speaking about the questions about her marriage, said, "Even my parents don't ask me so much about my marriage than the media and the public." She added her parents aren't bothered about her marriage as much as the public is. "Until I'm not ready to share my life with the world, I won't do it," she stated.

177.title: YouTuber Gaurav Taneja gets bail hours after arrest over stampede-like situation in Noida
177.article_body: YouTuber Gaurav Taneja, known as the 'Flying Beast', has been granted bail. He was arrested on Saturday under Section 188 after thousands of people gathered at a metro station in Noida to celebrate his birthday on his request. According to reports, there was a stampede-like situation at the station due to the rush, however, no casualties were reported.

178.title: Patently untrue: Amnesty India on money laundering allegations by ED
178.article_body: Amnesty International India has tweeted that the allegations levelled by Enforcement Directorate against them for money laundering are "patently untrue". It added, "Putting a squeeze on critics through trumped-up charges...has become routine for...government." The ED fined Amnesty India and former CEO Aakar Patel over ₹61 crore citing violations of the Foreign Exchange Management Act.

179.title: Witnessed people, bags being swept: Amarnath Yatra pilgrim recalls experience
179.article_body: Speaking about the Amarnath cloudburst incident which killed several people, one of the survivors Sumit, recalled how the gushing water washed away the tents. "We only saw water everywhere. We all had a harrowing experience as we witnessed people and bags being swept away by strong waves," Sumit said. "Within 10 minutes, eight casualties were reported," he said.

180.title: If elected, would urge govt to resolve Kashmir issue permanently: Sinha
180.article_body: Opposition’s Presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha on Saturday said that if elected, he would urge the government to resolve the Kashmir issue permanently and restore peace in the region. "If elected...one of my priorities would be to urge the government to…restore peace, justice, democracy, normalcy and end the hostile development towards Jammu and Kashmir," Sinha added.

181.title: We deserved to lose: Buttler on 49-run defeat in 2nd T20I vs India
181.article_body: England captain Jos Buttler said they deserved to lose the second T20I against India as they didn't play anywhere close to what they wanted in the game. "Any time you lose three wickets in the powerplay it is hard to catch up," he added. Chasing India's 171-run target, England were reduced to 27/3 before getting bundled out for 121 runs.

182.title: People say 'Enough of women empowerment': Taapsee on her female-centric films
182.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu, while speaking about her production house backing female-centric movies, said that people tell her, "Enough of women empowerment now". "The subject apparently feels jaded to the world...[The subject of] heroes taking revenge or men saving women doesn't feel exploited, but women standing up for their rights feels overexposed," she added.

183.title: We're moving towards gaining 100% results on issues of national consensus: Shah
183.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah said that we are moving towards achieving 100% results on issues that require building a national consensus. "He said although the role of the (zonal) council is advisory, he is happy that in his three years of experience, over 75% of issues in the (zonal) council have been resolved by consensus," an official statement said.

184.title: Man arrested by Delhi Police for cheating woman via matrimonial site
184.article_body: Delhi Police has arrested a man for allegedly posing as an ITBP officer on a matrimonial site and borrowing ₹12 lakh from a woman on the pretext of paying his family's medical bills. It was revealed during a police investigation that the 29-year-old man had several online matrimonial profiles with different names and duped several women of lakhs of rupees.

185.title: Video shows suitcases being loaded on Lanka Navy ship amid reports of President escaping
185.article_body: A video is going viral on social media which shows suitcases being loaded onto the Sri Lanka Navy Ship Gajabahu anchored at the Colombo port. Local media claimed that the suitcases were of President Gotabaya Rajapaksa. Rajapaksa reportedly escaped from his residence on Saturday afternoon after a mob, raising slogans of 'Gota, go home', overran the building's compound.

186.title: Abe was linked to religious group that caused mother's bankruptcy: Shooter to police
186.article_body: The man who shot Japan's former PM Shinzo Abe believed that the latter was linked to a religious group he blamed for his mother's bankruptcy, police told the local media. "My mother got wrapped up in a religious group and I resented it," reported local media quoting Tetsuya Yamagami. He reportedly spent months planning the attack with a homemade gun.

187.title: Congress can even join hands with terrorists to be in power: BJP's Patra
187.article_body: Reacting to the Congress party's statement that it will hold nationwide press conferences to counter BJP’s "fake nationalism", BJP spokesperson Sambit Patra said that Congress can even join hands with terrorists to be in power. Patra further said that the 10 years of UPA rule were "marked by frequent terror attacks" across India while PM Narendra Modi-led government controlled terrorism.

188.title: Rain expected in B'luru till July 13, city to remain chilly for 4 days: IMD
188.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has said that Bengaluru will continue receiving rainfall till July 13. "Bengaluru will continue to have chilly weather for next [four] days due to monsoon. July is the peak monsoon month. Since the Western Ghats are receiving heavy rain, the westerly winds are cold and Bengaluru is also facing its impact," an IMD scientist said.

189.title: Rishabh Pant's chat with Rohit Sharma after bowler comes in front of him goes viral
189.article_body: A video of Rishabh Pant's conversation with Rohit Sharma after England fast bowler David Willey came in front of him while they were running a single has gone viral. "Saamne aa gaya tha...Takkar maar du kya? (He came in front of him. Should I hit him?)" Pant said. Rohit responded, "Maar de. aur kya? (Hit him. What else?)"

190.title: Who will construct demolished wall: Banners on Hyd wall after BJP meet
190.article_body: The Parade Ground Walkers' Association has put up banners on the ground wall that was reportedly demolished for the public assembly for the Bharatiya Janata Party meeting on July 3. "Who will construct this demolished wall? Cantonment Board or BJP leaders?" the banners read. Pictures of the banners were shared on Twitter.

191.title: Actress Payal Rohatgi marries wrestler Sangram Singh in Agra, shares pics
191.article_body: Actress Payal Rohatgi tied the knot with wrestler Sangram Singh on Saturday in Agra. Payal and Sangram had first met in 2011 and the duo got engaged in 2014. The couple tied the knot in a traditional Hindu wedding ceremony attended by their friends and family. Payal completed her bridal look with heavy jewellery and minimal make-up.

192.title: Haryana govt to audit all 24 private universities
192.article_body: The Haryana government is set to order an audit of 24 private universities in the state, amid complaints that many institutions are flouting rules. The move comes after a show-cause notice was sent to Ashoka University, accusing it of "financial embezzlement" and violating the Haryana Private Universities Act. Erring universities could be fined up to ₹1 crore, an official said.

193.title: 2 teachers on panchayat poll duty killed in road mishap in MP
193.article_body: Two teachers on panchayat poll duty died on the spot after their car hit a tree in Madhya Pradesh's Shahdol district on Saturday. Shrikant Bahroliya, 42, and Laxmikant Patel, 40, were returning from poll duty when the mishap occurred, an official said. Two other occupants of the car were injured in the incident.

194.title: SC verdict on gangster Abu Salem's plea to come on July 11
194.article_body: The Supreme Court will deliver its verdict on July 11 on a petition by jailed gangster Abu Salem who has contended that his prison term cannot exceed 25 years under the extradition treaty between India and Portugal. Salem's counsel has further argued that his period of detention in Portugal should be set off against his sentence of imprisonment in India.

195.title: Macau to shut down casinos for a week to curb COVID-19 cases
195.article_body: Authorities on Saturday ordered the closure of casinos and other businesses for one week from Monday in view of the surge in COVID-19 cases in Macau. However, essential businesses like supermarkets, pharmacies and hotels will remain open, officials said. As per authorities, Macau recorded 71 new COVID-19 cases on Saturday, which takes the total cases reported since mid-June to 1,374.

196.title: Biden praises CIA for warning on Russian invasion of Ukraine
196.article_body: US President Joe Biden has officially thanked the Central Intelligence Agency (CIA) staff for cautioning the world ahead of Russia's invasion of Ukraine, describing it as the "quiet bravery" of American spies. Marking the CIA's 75th anniversary on Friday, Biden said he had been involved with the agency for 52 years, starting as junior senator in 1975.

197.title: UN blames Ukraine and Russia for attack on nursing home
197.article_body: A recent United Nations report has blamed Russian and Ukrainian forces for the infamous assault on a nursing home in Luhansk in March during the early stages of the war between the countries. The report said Ukrainian forces took positions inside the building, making it a target. Of the 71 persons in the building, 22 have been accounted as survivors.

198.title: Very unfortunate for Deepak to miss out: Irfan on India-England 2nd T20I
198.article_body: Following batter Deepak Hooda's omission from India's playing XI for second T20I against England in Birmingham, Irfan Pathan tweeted, "Very unfortunate for Deepak to miss out in this red hot form." In the first T20I in Southampton, Deepak batted at number three and scored 33 runs off 17 balls. He scored 47*, 104 in the recent India-Ireland two-match T20I series.

199.title: 6 Indian students participating in 63rd International Maths Olympiad
199.article_body: Six Indian students, Pranjal, Atul, Arjun, Adhitya, Vedant, Kaustav, are participating in the 63rd International Mathematical Olympiad, which is being held in Norway's capital Oslo. The Olympiad will run for two days on July 11 and 12, where contestants in teams of six must solve mathematical problems. Reportedly, about 600 students from around the world are participating in the Olympiad.

200.title: 32-year-old man arrested after Indian fans allege racism during Edgbaston Test
200.article_body: Birmingham Police have arrested a 32-year-old man for "racially aggravated public order offence", following allegations of racist abuse aimed at Indian fans during the rescheduled fifth Test between India and England at Edgbaston. Several Indian fans had taken to Twitter to report the racist behaviour they endured during the fourth day's play on Monday.

201.title: Sri Lankan President has agreed to resign on July 13, says Parliament Speaker
201.article_body: Sri Lanka's President Gotabaya Rajapaksa has agreed to step down on July 13, according to the Speaker of the Parliament Mahinda Yapa Abeywardana. Rajapaksa has faced a wave of anti-government protests amid a worsening economic crisis. Earlier on Saturday, reports had said that Rajapaksa ran away after protestors surrounded his residence.

202.title: Ukraine President sacks envoy to India, 4 other nations
202.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy dismissed Kyiv's ambassador to India on Saturday as well as several other foreign envoys, the presidential website said. In a decree that gave no reason for the move, he announced the sacking of Ukraine's ambassadors to India, Germany, Czech Republic, Norway and Hungary. It was not immediately clear if the envoys would be handed new jobs.

203.title: I didn't expect to be in the 2nd week: Rybakina on winning Wimbledon
203.article_body: After winning Wimbledon, Kazakhstan's Elena Rybakina said she didn't expect to be in the second week and to be a winner is amazing. "I wouldn't be here without my team of course, so I want to say a big thanks to them. And most importantly my parents." Notably, Rybakina was contesting a Wimbledon main draw for only the second time.

204.title: 9 killed as flood currents drag car into river in Uttarakhand
204.article_body: Nine people were killed and one sustained injuries after strong flood currents dragged their car into the Dhela river in Uttarakhand's Nainital district. Officials said the water levels in the river had increased due to heavy rains on Friday morning and that it was dark at the time of the accident. Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami condoled the deaths.

205.title: 'Shabaash Mithu' is balanced, shows success and failures: Director
205.article_body: 'Shabaash Mithu' director Srijit Mukherji has said that the upcoming film has a balanced approach, adding that it doesn't show only success but also failures. "When you have such achievements, you can't glorify or not glorify them. You show them the way they happened," the director added. The film is based on former Indian women's cricket team captain Mithali Raj.

206.title: Unacademy expands ESOP pool to $393 million: Report
206.article_body: Edtech unicorn Unacademy has expanded its employee stock ownership plan (ESOP) pool to $393 million, Inc42 reported citing sources. The Bengaluru-based startup increased its ESOP pool size to 286 million options from 238.7 million options, as per the company's regulatory filings with the Ministry of Corporate Affairs. Notably, the company sacked 150 employees last month.

207.title: Need to develop forward-looking higher education institutions: Pradhan
207.article_body: Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan on Saturday said we need to develop forward-looking, responsive and world-class higher education institutions in order to prepare 21st century-ready students. "National Education Policy 2020 gives us the direction and path for decolonizing our education and achieving aspirations, creating pride in our languages, culture and knowledge," Pradhan said.

208.title: Chinese man with 'urinary issues' told he has ovaries, uterus & has been menstruating
208.article_body: A 33-year-old Chinese man, who believed he had urinary problems after years of finding blood in his urine, was told by doctors he had ovaries and uterus. He also discovered recently that he had been menstruating for 20 years and had both male and female genitalia. He then underwent surgery to have his female reproductive organs removed.

209.title: US places visa restrictions on top Cuban officials
209.article_body: The US State Department on Saturday announced visa restrictions against 28 high-ranking Cuban officials for allegedly cracking down on peaceful protesters in Cuba last year. The restrictions will be applicable on members of the Cuban Communist Party, and authorities in the country's communications and media sectors. The US accused these officials of violent detention of protesters and sham trials.

210.title: Several injured as bus carrying 50 falls into gorge after tyre burst in Guj
210.article_body: A bus carrying over 50 passengers fell into a gorge in Gujarat's Dang district on Saturday. According to Minister of State for Home Harsh Sanghavi, several passengers have sustained injuries in the accident, which took place due to a tyre burst. Police reached the spot after getting information. A rescue operation is underway, Sanghavi added.

211.title: Refrain from commenting: Twitter tells staff after Musk ends deal
211.article_body: Twitter has instructed its employees not to comment about Elon Musk pulling out of an agreement to buy the platform. "You should refrain from Tweeting, Slacking, or sharing any commentary about the merger agreement," the company's General Counsel Sean Edgett said in a memo. Twitter plans to pursue legal action against Musk to enforce the deal.

212.title: Pope Francis prays for Japan after Shinzo Abe's assassination
212.article_body: Pope Francis prays that Japan will stay strong in its commitment to non-violence and heal from the “senseless” killing of former Prime Minister Shinzo Abe, the Vatican said on Saturday. In a social media message, Francis said he was “deeply saddened” by Abe's assassination. He expressed condolences to Abe's family and the people of Japan.

213.title: Undeniable that Shinzo Abe's security cover had flaws: Police
213.article_body: Tomoaki Onizuka, police chief of the Nara Prefecture, where former Japanese PM Shinzo Abe was shot dead, said on Saturday that it was "undeniable" that there were flaws in Abe's security cover. However, he did not list any specific shortcomings in the security measures undertaken for Abe. Onizuka said that a thorough investigation will be conducted to ascertain what happened.

214.title: I was super nervous: Rybakina after her 1st Grand Slam win at Wimbledon
214.article_body: World number 23 Elena Rybakina said her maiden Grand Slam win at Wimbledon is special because she was "super nervous" before and during the match. "I'm honestly happy that it's over. I've never felt something like this," she added. The 23-year-old defeated Ons Jabeur to become the first player from Kazakhstan to win a Grand Slam singles title on Saturday.

215.title: Russia assembling reserve forces near Ukraine: UK intelligence
215.article_body: Russia is moving reserve forces from across the country and assembling them near Ukraine for future offensive operations, the UK Ministry of Defence said on Saturday. A large proportion of the new infantry units are probably MT-LB armoured vehicles taken from long-term storage as the primary transport, it said, adding MT-LBs have very limited armour protection.

216.title: Jaishankar meets Lavrov, Blinken on sidelines of G-20 meet in Bali
216.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar met Russian counterpart Sergey Lavrov and US Secretary of State Antony Blinken on the sidelines of the G-20 Foreign Ministers' Conclave in Bali, Indonesia on Friday. Jaishankar discussed the Russia-Ukraine war and other regional issues with the leaders. India has called for diplomacy to end the Russia-Ukraine conflict.

217.title: Man arrested for alleged rape of his minor daughter in Rajasthan
217.article_body: A man was sent to judicial custody on Friday after being arrested for allegedly raping his minor daughter in Rajasthan's Hanumangarh district, police said. The girl has claimed in her FIR that her father had been raping her for one-and-a-half years years, police added. Police further said that the girl narrated her ordeal to her uncle.

218.title: It's a personal call by him: CSK official on Jadeja deleting CSK-related Instagram posts
218.article_body: Reacting to Ravindra Jadeja deleting some posts related to Chennai Super Kings (CSK) on his Instagram account, a CSK official told ANI, "This is a personal call by him." Further, refuting reports of any rift, the official added, "We are not aware of such kinds of incidents from our side. All OK. Nothing is wrong."

219.title: Tribal woman, set ablaze in MP last week, cremated in her village
219.article_body: Rampyari Bai, the tribal woman who died after being allegedly set ablaze by a group of men in MP's Guna district was cremated in her native village on Saturday. She was set on fire on July 2 over a land dispute. District Collector Frank Noble said the victim's family will get ₹8.25 lakh aid. Five persons have been arrested.

220.title: India defeat England in 2nd T20I, win 7th int'l series in a row under Rohit's captaincy
220.article_body: India defeated England by 49 runs in the second T20I at Edgbaston in Birmingham to take an unassailable 2-0 lead in the three-match series. With this, India recorded their 19th consecutive match win and seventh consecutive series win in international cricket under Rohit Sharma's captaincy. The third T20I will take place at Trent Bridge in Nottingham tomorrow.

221.title: 23-year-old Rybakina becomes youngest women's Wimbledon champion since 2011
221.article_body: Kazakhstan's Elena Rybakina, who turned 23 last month, has become the youngest player to win women's singles title at Wimbledon since a 21-year-old Petra Kvitova in 2011. The world number 23  beat world number two Ons Jabeur 3-6, 6-2, 6-2 in the final on Saturday. Rybakina ended the Tunisian's 11-match winning streak. Notably, it is Rybakina's first Grand Slam title.

222.title: LeT terrorist arrested in J&K, arms and ammunition recovered
222.article_body: The security forces on Saturday arrested a hybrid terrorist of Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) in the Kreeri area of Jammu and Kashmir's Baramulla district, police said on Saturday. According to police, the terrorist, who has been identified as Mohammad Iqbal Bhat, was actively involved in providing logistics support for terror activities. Arms and ammunition have also been recovered from his possession.

223.title: YouTuber Gaurav Taneja arrested after fans gather at Noida metro station for his b'day
223.article_body: Police arrested YouTuber Gaurav Taneja after his followers gathered at Sector 51 metro station in UP's Noida to celebrate his birthday. Taneja, through Instagram, told his followers he'd celebrate his birthday at the metro station among fans, following which thousands of people reached the metro station. There was a stampede-like situation due to the rush, but no casualties were reported.

224.title: Protesters set Sri Lankan PM's residence on fire after he agrees to quit, video surfaces
224.article_body: Protesters broke into the private residence of Sri Lankan PM Ranil Wickremesinghe and set it on fire, said his office. The protesters were seen damaging vehicles belonging to him. Wickremesinghe, who was appointed as Prime Minister in May, has announced that he will resign from his post to make way for an all-party government.

225.title: Missing T20 WC 2021 was one of the low points in my career: Ferguson
225.article_body: New Zealand pacer Lockie Ferguson has said missing 2021 T20 World Cup was probably one of the low points in his career. Ferguson was ruled out of World Cup squad due to a calf injury. Ferguson added that with a lot of cricket coming up he has the opportunity to work on his game leading into 2022 T20 World Cup.

226.title: Those using religion to divide people can't be true spiritualists: TN CM
226.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin on Saturday said that religion cannot be a tool to divide people and those who cause such a division cannot be true spiritualists. Addressing a gathering in Tiruvannamalai, Stalin said, "I don't care about those who utter lies and seek cheap publicity. Even you should not care but move on to embrace development."

227.title: Maoist hideout busted at Odisha-Chhattisgarh border, 60 Maoists escape
227.article_body: Police said a Maoist hideout was busted at the Odisha-Chhattisgarh border after a gunfight with the security forces. However, over 60 Maoists, including some female cadres, managed to escape the camp in Nuapada, police added. "Around 10 am on Friday, 60-80 Maoists opened fire, targeting the forces," police said, adding the forces retaliated and the gunfight lasted for an hour.

228.title: Crypto firm Blockchain.com loses $270 mn on loans to bankrupt firm 3AC
228.article_body: Cryptocurrency firm Blockchain.com has lost $270 million on its loans to crypto hedge fund Three Arrows Capital (3AC), according to Blockchain.com CEO Peter Smith's letter to the shareholders. This comes days after 3AC filed for bankruptcy, seeking protection from creditors in the US. Smith said that Blockchain.com remains liquid and solvent and its customers will not be impacted.

229.title: 'We don't get dirt in our eyes as they're small', jokes Naga minister; video viral
229.article_body: A video of Nagaland Higher Education and Tribal Affairs Minister Temjen Imna Along's speech on 'advantages of having small eyes' has gone viral online. "People say northeast Indians have small eyes...but I can see very well," joked Along. He added, "There are advantages to small eyes. We don't get dirt in our eyes. We can easily sleep during long programmes."

230.title: Learnt horse-riding for 'Shamshera', they need emotional connect: Vaani
230.article_body: Actress Vaani Kapoor has revealed that she had to take horse-riding lessons for her upcoming film 'Shamshera' which features Ranbir Kapoor and Sanjay Dutt. "You need that emotional connect with the animal. They will throw you off otherwise," she said. The actress added that she used to get a whole packet of biscuits to feed and befriend her horse.

231.title: J&K LG chairs high-level meet to review rescue op at Amarnath cave
231.article_body:
Jammu and Kashmir Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha on Saturday held a high-level meeting to review the ongoing rescue and relief operation at Amarnath cave. Two-minute silence was also observed during the meeting to pay tribute to devotees who lost their lives after the cloudburst happened in the lower reaches of the Amarnath cave on Friday, 
Office of J&K LG tweeted.

232.title: I had a DIY wedding & forgot to click pictures: Radhika Apte
232.article_body: Actress Radhika Apte has revealed that she has no pictures of her wedding with British violinist-composer Benedict Taylor because they forgot to click them. "We had a DIY marriage. We called our friends, made food ourselves...and partied. But no pictures," the actress said. The couple had a small wedding in 2012 before an official ceremony in 2013.

233.title: Tribals clash with forest officials in Telangana, 5 detained
233.article_body: Five tribal women were detained after a clash broke out between tribal members and forest authorities in Telangana's Mancherial. The clash broke out when the tribal members fought against the demolition of their huts on forest territory and three officials were injured. "But now they're telling us we can't even cultivate here. They're demolishing our huts," a protester said.

234.title: Can we change our self talk: Raqesh on rumours of breakup with Shamita
234.article_body: Addressing rumours of his breakup with Shamita Shetty, actor Raqesh Bapat recently shared a monochrome picture of himself on social media. He wrote in the caption, "Who is dating whom? Who is cheating whom?...vs...How can I be a better version of myself? Can we change our self talk? Is it that difficult?" The couple began dating during 'Bigg Boss OTT'.

235.title: Hundreds of users order food, alcohol for free as DoorDash app faces glitch in US
235.article_body: Hundreds of people were able to place free orders for food and alcohol after the American food delivery app DoorDash faced a glitch in its systems. Several users tweeted pictures of their orders, which ranged from expensive tequila to emergency contraceptives, and were worth thousands of dollars. The company has, however, said that it is "actively cancelling fraudulent orders".

236.title: 5-yr-old boy falls asleep, gets locked in UP classroom; teacher suspended
236.article_body: Days after a five-year-old student of a government school in Uttar Pradesh's Ballia got locked in a classroom after falling asleep, the school's head teacher was suspended and action was initiated against five other faculty members, officials said. The boy was later rescued by his family members, who had to break down the classroom door, as per reports.

237.title: 3 die, 47 fall ill after drinking polluted water from open wells in Maha
237.article_body: Three persons died and 47 others fell ill after drinking polluted water from open wells in two villages of Maharashtra's Amravati district, an official said on Saturday. Chief Minister Eknath Shinde has announced an ex-gratia of ₹5 lakh each to the families of the deceased, as per a statement issued by the Chief Minister's Office (CMO).

238.title: Russia raising 'true hell' in eastern Ukraine: Luhansk Governor
238.article_body: Russian forces have managed to "raise true hell" in Ukraine's east, Luhansk Governor Serhiy Gaidai said on Saturday, after Moscow launched artillery, mortar and rocket strikes in an overnight attack on the province. Russian troops are now pressing towards neighbouring Donetsk, he said. The Kyiv government has asked citizens to evacuate Russian-occupied southern areas ahead of a military pushback.

239.title: Raids against Karti Chidambaram show CBI has no work to do: TN Cong
239.article_body: After the CBI conducted searches at Congress MP Karti Chidambaram's residence in Chennai on Saturday, Tamil Nadu Congress President KS Alagiri said that these raids show that the CBI has got no work to do. "How many times would they raid his house? They have not found anything," Alagiri said. "Congress strongly condemns this," he added.

240.title: Measures taken to rescue pilgrims from K’taka on Amarnath Yatra: CM
240.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai said the government has taken all measures to rescue pilgrims from Karnataka who are on Amarnath Yatra after a cloudburst in Jammu and Kashmir. "Kannadigas from the state who are on Amarnath Yatra are safe," Bommai said. "Already about 15-20 Yatris have contacted us seeking help and providing information about their current location," he added.

241.title: Practice your religion but don't denigrate others' beliefs: Naidu
241.article_body: Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu on Saturday said that religion is a personal matter, adding that while one can take pride and practice one's religion, no one has the right to denigrate others' religious beliefs. He added that sporadic incidents cannot undermine the country's commitment to the values of pluralism and inclusivity.

242.title: Don't step out unless an emergency: T'gana CM to citizens amid rains
242.article_body: Telangana Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao on Saturday urged people not to venture out of their homes unless there is an emergency amid incessant rains in the state. He also instructed Chief Secretary Somesh Kumar to alert all the departments concerned and take safety measures amid heavy rainfall. The CM added that he was regularly reviewing the situation.

243.title: US concerned with China's 'alignment' with Russia: Blinken
243.article_body: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken said that he raised Washington's concerns regarding China's "alignment" with Russia since the beginning of the war in Ukraine, during in-person talks with Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi on Saturday. Blinken told reporters after the talks that he did not think China had acted neutrally, citing China's support to Russia in the United Nations.

244.title: How about India take 2007 T20 WC approach for 2022 T20 WC: Parthiv
244.article_body: Giving his opinion on Team India's preparations for T20 World Cup 2022, Parthiv Patel said, "How about India taking the 2007 T20 World Cup approach for this year's [T20] World Cup? More young faces and flamboyance." India won the inaugural T20 World Cup in 2007. Back then, Sachin Tendulkar, Sourav Ganguly and Rahul Dravid didn't play for the team.

245.title: Rybakina creates history, becomes 1st Kazakh player to win a Grand Slam singles title
245.article_body: World number 23 Elena Rybakina on Saturday created history by becoming the first-ever Kazakh player to win a Grand Slam singles title. The 23-year-old defeated world number two Ons Jabeur of Tunisia 3-6, 6-2, 6-2 to win the Wimbledon 2022 women's singles title. Both Rybakina and Jabeur were featuring in their first-ever Grand Slam final.

246.title: I don't support Kapil Dev's statements on Kohli: Rajkumar Sharma
246.article_body: Virat Kohli's childhood coach Rajkumar Sharma said he doesn't support the statements made by Kapil Dev on the ex-India captain. Kapil said that if Ravichandran Ashwin can be dropped from Test side then Kohli can also be dropped from T20I side following the India batter's recent form. Kohli has been included in India's playing XI against England in second T20I.

247.title: 4 injured in Shanghai hospital knife attack, attacker shot by police
247.article_body: A knife-wielding attacker injured four people at Ruijin Hospital in China's Shanghai on Saturday, local police confirmed. Police added that they shot the assailant in order to subdue him. Videos of the chaos during the attack have surfaced on social media. This is purportedly the second stabbing incident in the city after the withdrawal of COVID-19 restrictions in early June.

248.title: Place facts about Amarnath tragedy before country: Sinha to govt
248.article_body: Opposition's Presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha on Saturday expressed deep anguish over the loss of life in the Amarnath cloudburst incident. He further said that the central government should place facts about the incident before the nation and not hide anything. Notably, the death toll due to the cloudburst near Amarnath cave in Jammu and Kashmir has risen to 16.

249.title: 2 men thrown from boat in 'Circle of Death' rescued from sea in US, video viral
249.article_body: Two men were rescued off the coast of Massachusetts earlier this week after their out-of-control motorboat came dangerously close to a tight circle pattern, known as a 'Circle of Death', authorities said. The two men were thrown from the vessel and were neither wearing lifejackets nor were tethered to the boat's kill switch. The men were not injured, said police.

250.title: 4 die, 24 fall ill after drinking contaminated water in Telangana
250.article_body: Four persons died and 24 others fell ill within one week in Telangana after allegedly drinking contaminated water from their residences in Gadwal. Police have, however, refuted the claims and said the deaths were caused due to issues of improper hygiene and seasonal complications. The patients have been admitted to a hospital and are said to be out of danger.

251.title: Adani Group confirms it will participate in India's first auction of 5G spectrum
251.article_body: Adani Group has confirmed that it will participate in India's first auction of 5G airwaves through the open bidding process to offer private network services. However, it said that it does not plan to enter the consumer mobility space. Other companies that have applied to acquire the telecom spectrum include Reliance Jio Infocomm, Bharti Airtel and Vodafone Idea.

252.title: Payal Rohatgi, Sangram Singh share pics from pre-wedding festivities
252.article_body: Actress Payal Rohatgi and wrestler Sangram Singh have shared pictures of their pre-wedding festivities on social media ahead of their wedding on Saturday in Agra. The pictures are from their sangeet, mehendi and haldi ceremonies. The couple will be hosting a reception in Delhi on July 14 and another reception in Mumbai at a later date.

253.title: Vivo India pauses all ads featuring Kohli amid money laundering probe: Report
253.article_body: Vivo India has temporarily put on hold advertisements featuring cricketer Virat Kohli amid the ED's ongoing investigation against the Chinese firm, The Economic Times reported. A Vivo executive said planned promotion activities involving Kohli were being put on hold until there's clarity on the money laundering probe. "This is also to protect Virat from criticism," another executive said.

254.title: Sri Lankan PM Ranil Wickremesinghe resigns amid worsening crisis
254.article_body: Sri Lanka's Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe on Saturday announced his resignation. "To ensure the continuation of the government including the safety of all citizens I accept the best recommendation of the party leaders today, to make way for an all-party government. To facilitate this I will resign as Prime Minister," he tweeted. This comes amid worsening crisis in the country.

255.title: Sonu Sood, 'Roadies' team donate 1,000 raincoats to Mumbai Police
255.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood along with the team of MTV reality show 'Roadies' has donated 1,000 raincoats to Mumbai Police. "This contribution of a thousand raincoats from 'Roadies' is our way of saluting them and further equipping them for their duties," the actor said. The raincoats were created by a foundation that employs individuals from the marginalised sections of society.

256.title: 166 private PU colleges in B'luru record zero admissions in 3 years
256.article_body: A total of 166 private Pre-University (PU) colleges in Bengaluru have recorded zero admissions in the last three academic years. A district official blamed poor infrastructure and high fees in such colleges for this. He further said, "Bengaluru North (taluka) has seen a surge in government PU colleges where over 1,000-3,000 students have registered."

257.title: CBI conducts searches at Cong MP Karti Chidambaram's Chennai house
257.article_body: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) on Saturday conducted searches at the residence of Congress MP Karti Chidambaram in Chennai in connection with the Chinese visa case, officials said. During searches on May 17, a portion of Karti's home was sealed because keys of that portion were not available, officials added. Searches were resumed after the CBI received the keys.

258.title: B'luru Police seize assets of drug peddler for the first time
258.article_body: In a first, Bengaluru Police has attached various assets of an alleged drug peddler under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) Act, a senior official said on Saturday. Among the attached assets, there is an 8-acre land and five bank accounts with total funds worth ₹3 lakh, the official added. The accused has been identified as Mallesha.

259.title: India's HS Prannoy crashes out of Malaysia Masters, loses in semis
259.article_body: India's HS Prannoy crashed out of Malaysia Masters 2022 after losing to Hong Kong's Ng Ka Long Angus in the semi-final on Saturday. Eighth seeded Long Angus defeated unseeded Prannoy 17-21, 21-9, 21-17. With this, the Indian campaign has ended at the tournament. The 29-year-old Indian lost the match in one hour four minutes.

260.title: India announce their playing XI for 2nd T20I against England, make 4 changes
260.article_body: England captain Jos Buttler won the toss and elected to bowl first against India in the second T20I at the Edgbaston in Birmingham. India have made four changes to their playing XI with Virat Kohli, Ravindra Jadeja, Jasprit Bumrah and Rishabh Pant returning to the side. India lead the three-match series 1-0.

261.title: I puke thinking about my time in 'Bigg Boss': Kavita Kaushik
261.article_body: Television actress Kavita Kaushik said that she had a really bad experience when she was a contestant on reality show 'Bigg Boss 14'. She said that she regrets doing the show, adding, "I still feel sick sometimes thinking about it. I puke and stuff." The actress had earlier said that one has to be calculated and manipulative in the show.

262.title: Extremely painful: PM Modi after 6 died in road accident in UP
262.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday expressed grief after six people lost their lives and two others got injured after being hit by a pickup vehicle in Uttar Pradesh's Chitrakoot. "The accident...in Chitrakoot is extremely painful. My deepest condolences to those who have lost their loved ones in this," PM Modi said. "I wish the injured a speedy recovery," he added.

263.title: Freedom from COVID protocols: Bairstow on his recent form in Tests
263.article_body: England batter Jonny Bairstow has said the freedom from the COVID-19 protocols and clarity from new red-ball head coach Brendon McCullum are the reasons behind his recent form in Test cricket. "We can do normal things like go to the shop, go for a beer, see your friends...family," he added. Bairtsow has scored 597 runs in his last three Tests.

264.title: Andhra CM Jagan Reddy elected lifetime President of YSR Congress
264.article_body: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister YS Jagan Mohan Reddy was on Saturday elected the President for lifetime of the YSR Congress (YSRC) Party. The process was completed on the concluding day of the party's two-day plenary. Jagan established YSRC in March 2011 after quitting the Congress and was last elected the party chief in 2017.

265.title: I'm willing to resign: Sri Lankan PM Wickremesinghe amid worsening crisis
265.article_body: Sri Lanka's Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe on Saturday said that he's willing to resign and make way for an all-party government to take over. This came after protesters took to the streets in massive numbers and stormed the Presidential palace in Colombo as President Gotabaya Rajapaksa reportedly fled. Sri Lanka is facing its worst economic crisis in over seven decades.

266.title: Katrina Kaif is the torchbearer of action heroines: Sanjana Sanghi
266.article_body: Actress Sanjana Sanghi said in an interview that actress Katrina Kaif is the torchbearer in the film industry for women doing action films. She added that very few women have done full-fledged action parts. The actress further said that the writing of female characters has gone a notch higher because of actresses like Deepika Padukone, Taapsee Pannu and Vidya Balan.

267.title: Most young singers try to sound like Arijit, Atif: Amaal Mallik
267.article_body: Singer-composer Amaal Mallik has stated that most young singers nowadays "go nasal, gimmicky or try to sound like Arijit Singh or Atif Aslam". He further said that the correct pronunciation is a problem with most young singers and they are not clear with their Hindi like the older generation was. Amaal's single 'Chalo Theek Hai' was released recently.

268.title: My govt will complete its tenure, we'll even win next poll: Shinde
268.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Saturday said that his government will complete its tenure, adding, "We'll even win next election." While speaking at a press conference, he said that it is only the natural alliance of the BJP and Shiv Sena that can take Maharashtra ahead. Earlier today, BJP chief JP Nadda held a meeting with Shinde on cabinet expansion.

269.title: New warrant issued against Alt News' Zubair in UP's Lakhimpur Kheri
269.article_body: A court in Uttar Pradesh's Lakhimpur Kheri has issued a warrant summoning Alt News Co-founder Mohammed Zubair before it on July 11 in a case lodged last year for allegedly promoting enmity between two groups. This came hours after being granted bail by Supreme Court in a case registered against him in Sitapur, for allegedly calling three Hindu seers "hatemongers".

270.title: Police Inspector thrashes & rapes wife of former accused, kidnaps couple in Hyd
270.article_body: A police Inspector allegedly thrashed and raped the wife of a man whom he had arrested in the past and also kidnapped the couple in Telangana's Hyderabad, police said. Marredpally SHO Nageshwar Rao allegedly raped the woman in her house on July 7 and threatened the couple to leave Hyderabad. He later took them away in his car, police said.

271.title: Tsunami of unemployment has hit the nation under BJP's rule: Rahul
271.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday took to Twitter and alleged, "Under the BJP's rule, the prices of domestic LPG cylinders went up by 157%, fuel prices broke all records and the 'Gabbar Tax loot' and a 'tsunami of unemployment' hit the country." "[Public] is telling PM Narendra Modi...these obstacles created by you have exhausted us, now stop," Gandhi added.

272.title: Farooq Abdullah demands probe in Amarnath cloudburst incident
272.article_body: J&K National Conference chief Farooq Abdullah has demanded an investigation into the Amarnath cloudburst incident, adding that the government should explain what happened and how. Calling the incident unfortunate, he said, "Basis on which tents were put up at such...risky place should be investigated. It's the first time when tents were placed there." Sixteen people have died in the incident.

273.title: Not ideal to have 7 captains in such short span of time, got to feel for Dravid: Ganguly
273.article_body: Talking about Team India, BCCI President Sourav Ganguly said it isn't ideal to have seven different captains in such a short span of time. "But it has happened because of an unavoidable situation," he added. "The calendar is such that we've had to give players breaks and then there have been injuries...You got to feel for Rahul Dravid," Ganguly stated.

274.title: Telangana govt starts 'Dalit Bandhu Scheme' to empower community
274.article_body: The Telangana government has distributed commercial vehicles to the Dalit community in Hyderabad under the 'Dalit Bandhu Scheme', which is aimed at empowering the community and lifting them out of poverty. "Dalit Bandhu is a unique scheme in which ₹10 lakh will be given to Dalit families. They can use this for doing business," an SC Corporation official said.

275.title: Thane elderly couple robbed of valuables worth ₹8 lakh at knifepoint
275.article_body: Police said that an elderly couple was robbed of valuables worth over ₹8.82 lakh by unidentified men who broke into their house in Thane. Four unidentified persons entered the house from the kitchen door and brandished a knife at 62-year-old Baban Kalu Mhatre and his wife, a police official said. A case has been registered under IPC section 392 (robbery).

276.title: Hyderabad man dies by suicide over debts due to online gambling
276.article_body: A 36-year-old man, Dattatreya, died by suicide on Friday in Hyderabad after being unable to repay loans worth ₹7 lakh. According to police, the deceased was addicted to online gambling for the last two years and raised loans from banks and other sources. Police found a suicide note at his residence, which said he was being harassed to repay loans.

277.title: Secularism in blood & veins of every individual in India: VP Naidu
277.article_body:
Vice President Venkaiah Naidu on Saturday said secularism is safe in India, not because of any government or political party, but because it's in the blood and veins of every individual living here. 
"Ours is a great country, fortunately India is again on the move, world is now recognising and respecting India once again, nobody can ignore us," Naidu said.

278.title: 20 take road trip from Pune to Hyd as flight cancelled last moment
278.article_body: Twenty people were reportedly forced to take the roadway to reach Hyderabad from Pune after their Alliance Air Pune-Hyderabad flight was cancelled at the last moment. "There was no assistance provided by Alliance Air...[It] was...very pathetic situation," a traveller said. The airline reportedly announced the flight cancellation when the passengers were waiting at the boarding gate at the airport.

279.title: 110 kg of marijuana worth ₹11 lakh seized in Thane, 1 arrested
279.article_body: Police on Friday said that they seized 110 kg of marijuana worth ₹11 lakh and arrested one person in Thane. Acting on a tip-off, Crime Unit V laid a trap near Kapurbawdi fire station around 9 pm on Thursday and intercepted a tempo, senior inspector Vikas Ghodke said. Police also seized the tempo and some cash from the accused.

280.title: GHMC imposes ₹120 cr fine on hoardings, collects ₹12 cr in Hyderabad
280.article_body: Three years after a ban was imposed on illegal hoardings in Hyderabad, the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) imposed a penalty of ₹120 crore on violators, but has collected only ₹12 crore. "We had conducted a drive during April and issued 1,321 challans against printing agencies," a GHMC official said. The civic body has not taken action against the violators.

281.title: Nokia, IISc to set up robotics Center of Excellence in Bengaluru
281.article_body: Nokia and the Indian Institute of Science (IISc) have partnered to set up a Center of Excellence (CoE) in Bengaluru. The CoE will promote inter-disciplinary research in robotics and advanced communication technologies in 5G and Artificial Intelligence (AI), as per a joint statement. The CoE will also develop use cases across industrial automation, agriculture and disaster management, it added.

282.title: 12 students from Kerala arrested for selling ganja in Mangaluru
282.article_body: Police arrested 12 students, all residents of Kerala, studying in different private colleges across Mangaluru for allegedly possessing and selling ganja. They seized 900 grams of ganja worth ₹20,000, smoking pipes, rolling papers, ₹4,500 cash, 11 mobile phones and an electronic weighing machine from them. After a medical examination, 11 of the 12 accused were found positive for consuming drugs.

283.title: 78 kg garbage dropped from the space station for the first time, video released
283.article_body: The International Space Station (ISS) sustainably released around 172 pounds (78 kg) of waste using a first-of-its-kind specialised trash bag on July 2. The specialised bag has been developed by NASA's Johnson Space Center and Nanoracks and contains filthy garments, foam, packing materials, used office supplies, and hygiene items. The bag will burn up while re-entering Earth's atmosphere.

284.title: UP bride calls off wedding, says groom looked 'fair coloured in the photo'
284.article_body: A bride in Uttar Pradesh's Etawah called off her wedding, alleging that the groom looked fair coloured in the photograph that she was shown earlier. Her mother also claimed that everyone in her family was sure that the groom was not the man they had seen in photo. As the issue wasn't resolved, the groom's family had to return empty-handed.

285.title: It's a cause for worry: Sunil Gavaskar on India failing to defend 378
285.article_body: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said India's failure to defend a 378-run target in the fifth Test against England is a "cause for worry". "They did it with so much time to spare...they got 120 runs in 100 minutes," added Gavaskar. "Maybe we didn't try different angles...maybe we could've made bowling changes...Every...time the batter seemed to have more determination," he stated.

286.title: Djokovic fears Kyrgios' unreadable serve: Ex-member of Serbian tennis team
286.article_body: Former member of the Serbian tennis team, Craig O'Shannessy, has said that 20-time Grand Slam champion Novak Djokovic "fears" the "unreadable" serve of Australia's Nick Kyrgios. "Novak fears that service game. He absolutely does and that's self-evident with Novak nominating Nick as the best serve he's played against," O'Shannessy said. The two players will meet in the Wimbledon final tomorrow.

287.title: We 'complied under protest' with govt's blocking orders: Twitter
287.article_body: Twitter "complied under protest" with the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology's (MeitY) recent orders to block 39 specific accounts, Moneycontrol reported citing a petition by the company in the Karnataka High Court. The petition said these orders were overbroad and disproportionate and did not meet the requirements of Section 69A of the Information Technology Act, 2000.

288.title: Broad would've attempted 6 each ball if Root or Bairstow got out: Anderson
288.article_body: Discussing England's win in the fifth Test against India, James Anderson said Stuart Broad was the next batter in case Jonny Bairstow or Joe Root got dismissed and would've attempted a six every ball. Bairstow and Root shared an unbeaten 269-run partnership as England chased down the 378-run target. "[Nobody was] padded up for the last 20 runs," added Anderson.

289.title: I'd do Jaya Prada's moves on 'Dafaliwale', dad never found it strange: Johar
289.article_body: Karan Johar said that his late father, producer Yash Johar, was a "very progressive thinking and a very open-hearted man". "He never made me feel like I was different from anybody else," Karan added. "I used to dance to 'Dafaliwale', he was so proud of it...[He] never...thought...it was strange that his eight-year-old son is dancing to...Jaya Prada's movements," he said.

290.title: Andhra CM Jagan Reddy elected as YSR Congress' lifetime President
290.article_body: Andhra Pradesh CM YS Jagan Mohan Reddy was elected as the lifetime President of his party, Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress (YSRC). The announcement was made on the concluding day of the YSRC's two-day plenary. Notably, the party's constitution was amended to enable CM Jagan for the post, especially after his mother, Vijayamma, had quit as YSRC's honorary President.

291.title: Vignesh Shivan shares unseen pics from wedding on 1 month anniversary
291.article_body: Director Vignesh Shivan took to Instagram on Saturday to share a post marking one month of his wedding with actress Nayanthara. He shared a series of unseen pictures, featuring Shah Rukh Khan, Rajinikanth, directors Atlee and Mani Ratnam. "Blessed to have this humble...and wonderful human being with us during our wedding," Vignesh wrote while sharing pictures with Shah Rukh.

292.title: As a tennis fan, I'm glad Kyrgios made it to Wimbledon final: Djokovic
292.article_body: Defending champion Novak Djokovic said it's surprising that world number 40 Nick Kyrgios has reached Wimbledon final because of his ranking. "As a tennis fan, I'm glad he made it to...final, he's very talented," he added. Kyrgios reached his maiden Grand Slam final after Rafael Nadal withdrew before their semi-final match. Djokovic will face unseeded Kyrgios in final on Sunday.

293.title: Bharat Alt Fuel to invest ₹250 crore to build EV plant in Tamil Nadu
293.article_body: Alternative fuel technology startup Bharat Alt Fuel has announced its plan to invest ₹250 crore to build a plant in Tamil Nadu that will produce electric vehicles, batteries and motors. The construction of the 40,000 square metres plant in Krishnagiri is expected to begin in Q4 of 2022-23. Initial production capacity will be 25,000 EVs, going up to 1,00,000 gradually.

294.title: Govt shows Meta's stall showcasing AR/VR tech at Digital India Week
294.article_body: The IT ministry took to Twitter to share a video of the stall of Facebook-parent Meta at the Digital India Week 2022. "They are showcasing how AR/VR technologies can be used across key sectors like skilling and education," the ministry said. Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated Digital India Week on July 4.

295.title: UP man who once worked as airport cleaner in Aus now millionaire CEO of IT firm
295.article_body: Aamir Qutub, a 33-year-old Indian-origin man who once worked as an airport cleaner in Australia, is now the millionaire CEO of IT firm Enterprise Monkey. Qutub told Daily Mail when he moved from Uttar Pradesh to Australia 10 years ago, he submitted 300 job applications but they were all rejected. "It was hard to find jobs without experience," he added.

296.title: Ronaldo leaving Man Utd is not about money: Ex-Arsenal defender
296.article_body: Former Arsenal defender Bacary Sagna has commented on the ongoing speculations of Portuguese footballer Cristiano Ronaldo leaving the Manchester United club in the coming weeks. "Ronaldo is a football lover...I'm sure he would have been disappointed with the season that Manchester United had...All he wants to do is play football. It has nothing to do with money," Sagna said.

297.title: Tripura to restart scheme to bring back students who dropped out
297.article_body: Tripura government will restart 'Vidyalaya Chalo Abhiyan' after school authorities reported that nearly 8,850 school students dropped out amid COVID-19, according to state Education Minister Ratan Lal Nath. The state government will also launch 'Earn with Learn' scheme for college students, wherein they will conduct surveys to identify dropouts and will be paid ₹500 for each re-admission.

298.title: Pune airport Director asks airlines to take care of flyers in rains
298.article_body: Amid heavy rains, Pune airport authorities have directed all airlines to take care of flyers. Pune airport Director Santosh Dhoke said, "We've instructed all airlines that during rains, they should use...aerobridge every time so that flyers don't face any problems." This comes after flyers complained about having to walk in the rain while boarding the Pune-Jaipur SpiceJet flight on Thursday.

299.title: Man breaking rules stabs policeman, drives car with him on bonnet in Mumbai
299.article_body: A car driver reportedly assaulted a policeman in Navi Mumbai's Kharghar. According to the Twitter user who shared video of the incident, the accused tried to flee the spot after breaking traffic rules. But when the policeman came in front of his car, he stabbed him and drove the car for about 500 metres with the policeman hanging on bonnet.

300.title: Kedarnath Yatra halted amid heavy rains to ensure pilgrims' safety
300.article_body: The Rudraprayag district administration in Uttarakhand on Saturday announced that the Kedarnath Yatra has been stopped in the wake of heavy rainfall from Sonprayag onwards. The district administration informed that the decision has been taken to ensure pilgrims' safety amid fears of untoward incidents. At least 16 people died after flash floods near Jammu and Kashmir's Amarnath cave on Friday.

301.title: Panasonic sues Broadcom for infringing its computer-technology patents
301.article_body: Japanese electronics maker Panasonic on Thursday sued chipmaker Broadcom for allegedly violating its rights in several computer-technology patents. In the lawsuit, Panasonic alleged that Broadcom's products including microprocessors, integrated circuits and components used in wireless networking infringe 10 of its patents. Panasonic has demanded an unspecified amount of money in damages.

302.title: Brazilian startup Creditas extends $260 mn funding round to buy bank
302.article_body: Brazilian fintech startup Creditas has announced a $50 million extension to its $260 million Series F financing round. As per a press release, the extension is helping the firm in buying the Brazilian banking license of Andorra-based Andbank, which will participate in the round. The license deal, reportedly worth $100 million, is yet to get approved by Brazil's central bank.

303.title: 2 from Raj arrested by B'luru Police for looting ₹1.58cr ornaments
303.article_body: Two individuals were arrested from Rajasthan by a Bengaluru Electronic City Police team for looting ornaments worth ₹1.58 crore at gunpoint from a jewellery shop in the city, officials said on Friday. The accused were arrested within 72 hours of the robbery, police said. Police added that the alleged robbers came into the shop posing as customers.

304.title: Sangakkara shares video of thousands protesting outside Presidential Secretariat in SL
304.article_body: Former Sri Lanka captain Kumar Sangakkara took to Twitter to share a video of thousands of people protesting outside the Presidential Secretariat in Sri Lanka's Colombo. "This is for our future," Sangakkara wrote alongside the video. Earlier today, the protesters also broke into the official residence of President Gotabaya Rajapaksa.

305.title: Shawn Mendes postpones 3 weeks of shows over mental health, shares note
305.article_body: Singer Shawn Mendes shared a note on Instagram on Friday writing that he is postponing three weeks of his 'Wonder: The World Tour' due to his mental health. He wrote, "I've been touring since I was 15...After a few years off the road, I was ready to dive back in but the decision was premature...and I've hit a breaking point."

306.title: Google proposes moving ad business to Alphabet to avoid lawsuit: Report
306.article_body: Google has offered to move its ad auctions business into a separate company under Alphabet to avoid a potential US antitrust lawsuit, reports stated. It is reportedly part of multiple concessions Google has offered the Department of Justice to avoid lawsuits alleging anti-competitive practices. The DoJ is reportedly preparing a lawsuit alleging Google's ad-tech practices are anti-competitive.

307.title: Man attacks wife, her family with swords, then kills self in Punjab
307.article_body: A man allegedly attacked his wife and four members of her family with swords at her house in Punjab's Moga on Saturday, then returned to his own house and died by suicide. The deceased's wife had started living separately after the couple had a dispute, SHO said. When the wife refused to return, the deceased attacked them, according to police.

308.title: Former SL cricket captain Jayasuriya joins protest against country's Prez, shares pics
308.article_body: Former Sri Lanka cricket captain Sanath Jayasuriya on Saturday joined the protest against Sri Lanka President Gotabaya Rajapaksa. "I always stand with the people of Sri Lanka. And will celebrate victory soon," he tweeted while sharing pictures. "The siege is over. Your bastion has fallen...Please have the dignity to resign now! #GoHomeGota," Jayasuriya wrote in another tweet.

309.title: Maharashtra man tears passport pages to hide Maldives trip with lover from wife; arrested
309.article_body: A Maharashtra man has been arrested for tearing the pages of his passport to hide Maldives trip with his lover from his wife. Immigration authorities handed him over to the police, who placed him under arrest on charges of cheating and forgery. The man told his wife that he was going on an official trip.

310.title: Never thought 'Teri Maa Ka Mukut' dialogue would become a craze: Shamshera maker
310.article_body: Director Karan Malhotra spoke about the viral 'Teri Maa Ka Mukut' dialogue mouthed by Sanjay Dutt in the trailer of 'Shamshera' and said he had never imagined the dialogue would become such a craze. "From the day the trailer released, the dialogue has been trending," he added. Karan further said the dialogue was not originally a part of the script.

311.title: Was told B'wood is the 'worst place', 'full of monsters, demons': Kubbra
311.article_body: Actress Kubbra Sait said in an interview that when she entered the film industry, she was told that it is full of "monsters and demons". "I was told...this is the worst place to be in and...I should just pack off and go," Kubbra said, adding, "But now when I look back, I couldn't have been in a more noble profession."

312.title: Might be a full stop: Finch hints on his possible retirement
312.article_body: Australian white-ball skipper Aaron Finch (35) has hinted at his possible retirement from cricket after this year's ICC T20 World Cup. "It might be a full stop on everything [several players retiring from T20Is, including him] if it goes to plan like that," Finch said. "When guys get to their mid-30s, it's going to be that way," he added.

313.title: Bank of Spain registers Binance as virtual asset services provider
313.article_body: Bank of Spain has registered world's largest crypto exchange Binance's local unit, Moon Tech Spain, as a virtual asset services provider. This enables the firm to offer its services in Spain in compliance with the bank's anti-money laundering and counter-terrorist financing rules, Binance said. The bank, however, clarified that the registration doesn't mean it approves the firm's activities.

314.title: Reach out to potential startups, support them: MoS to officials
314.article_body: Minister of State for Science and Technology Jitendra Singh on Friday urged government officials and agencies to reach out to potential startups and support them. This will ensure that startup initiatives that may not have taken off because of inadequate support or resources don't get left out, he added. Singh said budding startups are going to shape India's future economy.

315.title: Actress Kirsten Dunst marries Jesse Plemons after 6 years of dating
315.article_body: Actress Kirsten Dunst and actor Jesse Plemons recently got married after being together for six years, confirmed Kirsten's representative. The couple tied the knot at the GoldenEye resort in Jamaica's Ocho Rios. The 40-year-old actress got engaged to the 34-year-old actor in January 2017. The couple welcomed their first son in 2018 and their second son in 2021.

316.title: Tesla's new German plant to halt production for 2 weeks: Reports
316.article_body: Tesla's newly-opened Gigafactory near Berlin in Germany will stop production for two weeks starting July 11, according to media reports. The factory, which started production in March-end, will reportedly undergo maintenance work to shorten its manufacturing time. It produced 1,000 vehicles per week in June, around a tenth of what it aims to produce, German tabloid Bild reported.

317.title: Future wars are all about drones, crews of planes have no chance: Musk
317.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk in response to a video on drones said, "Future wars are all about the drones. Human crews of planes or tanks have no chance." The video showed a drone being piloted by "computer vision". However, Musk pointed out an exception to his proposition, saying, "A purely analogue, human-controlled vehicle is far more resilient to EMF weapons."

318.title: India's 1st e-waste eco-park to be built in Delhi's Holambi Kalan
318.article_body: Delhi Environment Minister Gopal Rai held a review meeting with officials of the Delhi Pollution Control Committee over the construction of India's first e-waste eco-park in the city. Rai said the park will be developed in Delhi's Holambi Kalan in an area of about 21 acres and will be completed in 23 months. It'll significantly reduce Delhi's pollution, he added.

319.title: Court dismisses bail plea of Delhi policeman held in kidnapping case
319.article_body: A Delhi court dismissed the bail plea of a Delhi policeman, held in a kidnapping case, on grounds of the "serious nature of the allegations and the gravity of offence". A youth was arrested and the accused demanded a ₹2 lakh ransom. The counsel for the accused claimed that his client has been falsely implicated in the case.

320.title: SP Founder Mulayam Singh Yadav's wife Sadhna Gupta passes away
320.article_body: Samajwadi Party (SP) Founder Mulayam Singh Yadav's wife Sadhna Gupta passed away at a hospital in Gurugram on Saturday. Gupta was reportedly admitted to Medanta hospital, where she was undergoing treatment for a lung disease. She had been ill for a long time and was in the ICU for the last four days, reports further stated.

321.title: No doubt he'll be aggressive: Djokovic on facing Kyrgios in Wimbledon final
321.article_body: Top seed Novak Djokovic said there is no doubt about unseeded Nick Kyrgios playing aggressively in Wimbledon final. "I expect him to do that," he added. "He plays lights-out every time he steps out onto the court. Just [has] a lot of power in his serve and his game," he further said. Kyrgios leads Djokovic 2-0 in their head-to-head.

322.title: 6 mowed down by loader in UP's Chitrakoot; CM Yogi announces ex gratia
322.article_body: Six people died after being mowed down by a loader in Uttar Pradesh's Chitrakoot on Saturday. The accident took place when the driver of the vehicle lost control and ran over people sitting on the footpath. CM Yogi Adityanath has announced an ex gratia of ₹2 lakh to the families of the deceased and ₹50,000 to the injured.

323.title: SP chief Akhilesh's uncle supports NDA prez nominee, calls Akhilesh 'immature'
323.article_body: SP chief Akhilesh Yadav's uncle Shivpal Yadav has declared support for NDA's presidential nominee Droupadi Murmu. Shivpal, who heads Pragatisheel Samajwadi Party-Lohia, announced his decision after attending a dinner hosted by UP CM Yogi Adityanath for Murmu. He said he wasn't invited to meet with the opposition's presidential nominee Yashwant Sinha and called Akhilesh "politically immature".

324.title: Tata Motors passenger vehicle range gets a price hike of 0.55%
324.article_body: Tata Motors has raised the prices of its passenger vehicle range with immediate effect in order to partially offset the impact of rising input costs. The price hike is fixed at 0.55% and will be levied across the models from today. The firm has already hiked the prices of its commercial vehicle range by 1.5%-2.5% from July.

325.title: CBI files charge-sheet in West Bengal's Hanskhali gang-rape case
325.article_body: CBI filed a charge-sheet against nine accused in connection with the Hanskhali gang-rape case in West Bengal's Nadia on April 4 during a birthday party at the house of a TMC panchayat official's son. "The minor was allegedly gang-raped by three accused after being intoxicated," CBI claimed. "It was also alleged...accused immediately took her dead body...cremated it," CBI added.

326.title: Over 30,000 houses damaged due to recent Assam floods: CM Sarma
326.article_body: As many as 30,000 to 40,000 houses were damaged in Assam due to the recent massive floods, CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said, while adding that he has sought an advance amount from the National Disaster Response Fund (NDRF) to help the affected people. Sarma said Union Home Minister Amit Shah has assured him that his request would be actively considered.

327.title: Cab driver runs over dog sleeping on roadside in B'luru; arrested
327.article_body: A cab driver was arrested for allegedly running his vehicle over a stray dog who was sleeping on the roadside in Bengaluru, police said on Saturday. While locals claimed that the accused had "deliberately" run over the dog, the accused had maintained that he did not notice the sleeping dog. The cab driver was arrested based on CCTV footage.

328.title: Pics of pregnant Alia Bhatt from sets of her H'wood debut with Gal Gadot surface
328.article_body: New pictures of Alia Bhatt shooting her Hollywood debut 'Heart of Stone' in Portugal have emerged online. She had earlier shared a picture with her co-star Gal Gadot on Instagram after wrapping up the project, which will also star Jamie Dornan. The actress is expecting her first child with actor-husband Ranbir Kapoor.

329.title: Salt and Pepper get each other out during T20 match in England, fans react
329.article_body: Essex's Michael Pepper and Lancashire's Phil Salt were involved in each other's dismissals during the T20 Blast quarter-final. Salt stumped Pepper, while Pepper was involved in a relay catch to dismiss Salt. "Reminds me of Mustard and Onions," a fan wrote referring to ex-England cricketers Phil Mustard and Graham Onions. "The game needed some spicing up," wrote another.

330.title: Ola cutting jobs, delays appraisals citing business restructuring: Report
330.article_body: Ola is cutting jobs and has deferred the performance appraisal for employees for the year as it aims at "leaner and consolidated teams" to keep its "strong profitability intact", as per a report. Ola's HR reportedly told employees, "We're working on the restructuring of some of our businesses." It is reported that as many as 500 employees could be fired.

331.title: There's lot of age-tagging in B'wood, you're too old or too young: Nimrat
331.article_body: Actress Nimrat Kaur has stated that there is a lot of age-tagging in the film industry, adding you are either considered too old or too young to be doing things. "Whether it's a man or woman, age is a very jaded way of looking at a person. I strongly believe that ageism is extremely outdated and unfashionable," the actress said.

332.title: 37-yr-old Faf is playing well; should be in T20 WC squad: Morkel
332.article_body: Former South African pacer Morne Morkel has said that ex-skipper Faf du Plessis (37) should be included in the South African squad for this year's T20 World Cup. "Faf is still playing well...he has done exceptionally well for RCB," Morkel said. "I honestly believe that South Africa have an attack that is going to suit Australian conditions well," Morkel added.

333.title: Delhi launches 'Paryavaran Mitra' campaign to improve environment
333.article_body: Delhi government has launched a 'Paryavaran Mitra' campaign to improve the city's environment. Under the campaign, the government will register people working or willing to work for environmental protection as 'Paryavaran Mitra' and form ward-level teams,  Environment Minister Gopal Rai said. Notably, 1,742 volunteers registered themselves as 'Paryavaran Mitras' within a day of its launch.

334.title: Assam floods death toll reaches 190; over 8.88 lakh people still affected
334.article_body: The total death toll due to Assam floods and landslides has risen to 190, the Assam State Disaster Management Authority (ASDMA) said. This comes after two persons, including a child, died in flood waters and another person died in a landslide. More than 8.88 lakh people continue to be impacted with 620 villages still under the impact of floods.

335.title: Amarnath flash floods may be due to highly-localised rain event: IMD
335.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has said that the recent deaths and destruction near Amarnath cave in Jammu and Kashmir were due to a highly-localised rain event and not due to a cloudburst. According to weather scientists, the shrine reported 31 mm of rainfall from 4.30-6.30 pm on Friday, which is quite low to be categorised as a cloudburst.

336.title: Protestors swim in Presidential palace's pool in Sri Lanka after President runs away
336.article_body: A video showing protestors swimming in Sri Lanka Presidential palace's pool has gone viral on social media. Earlier, reports said that President Gotabaya Rajapaksa ran away after the protestors surrounded the palace. Meanwhile, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe has summoned an urgent cabinet meeting and has also requested the Speaker to summon the Parliament.

337.title: Google removes 4 apps from Play Store after Joker malware detected
337.article_body: Google has removed four apps from Play Store that were found to be infected with 'Joker' malware. Cybersecurity company Pradeo had issued a warning about these apps, saying they could be used to commit fraud through in-app purchases, calls or text messages. The four banned apps are Smart SMS Messages, Blood Pressure Monitor, Voice Languages Translator and Quick Text SMS.

338.title: I don't focus on speed: Ferguson on clocking the fastest ball of IPL 2022
338.article_body: Talking about bowling the fastest delivery of the IPL 2022, GT pacer Lockie Ferguson said he doesn't focus on the speed during the game. "It's never really a thought and...there are so many other thoughts around scouting, the batter I'm bowling to and what I'm trying to achieve with that ball," he added. Ferguson clocked 157.3 kmph in the final.

339.title: No matter what, if Kohli is available he'll play: Ishant on 2nd T20I
339.article_body: Amid talks over Virat Kohli's spot in the T20I side, considering the criticism over his low strike rate, pacer Ishant Sharma said Kohli will play in the second T20I against England if he's available. "It'll be hard on Deepak Hooda because Kohli will [bat at number three]," added Ishant. Kohli is a part of the squad for the remaining T20Is.

340.title: Woman, her lover arrested for plotting her father's murder in Raj
340.article_body: After a 47-year-old man was beaten to death in Rajasthan's Kota, police arrested his daughter and her lover for allegedly plotting to kill him and hiring five people for ₹50,000 to do it. During interrogation, it was revealed that the daughter was fed up with her alcoholic father, who had a heavy debt. The father's murder took place in June.

341.title: Was scared, thought I'd collapse: Sargun on shooting for B'wood debut film
341.article_body: Actress Sargun Mehta, speaking about shooting for her Bollywood debut film 'Mission Cinderella' which also stars Akshay Kumar, said that she was very scared initially. "Everything was giving me...jitters and I can't...begin to tell you how I gave my first shot," Sargun said, adding, "I thought I'd collapse...It was a...tough role and I was thinking about how I'd do it."

342.title: Illegal casino busted in Noida; 10 including 4 Nepalese nationals arrested
342.article_body: Noida Police on Friday reportedly busted an illegal casino set up inside a flat at a housing society in Greater Noida and arrested 10 people, including four Nepalese nationals. "Over ₹1 lakh cash...liquor bottles among other items were seized," a police officer said. Moreover, three decks of cards, two casino tables and 3,145 coins were also seized from the spot.

343.title: End of season 1, what a cliffhanger: Twitter staff after Musk ends $44 bn deal
343.article_body: Reacting to Tesla CEO Elon Musk terminating the $44 billion Twitter deal, an employee at the social media company said, "I just don’t believe it’s actually over." Meanwhile, Amir Shevat, another Twitter employee wrote, "End of season one- what a cliffhanger." Other staff members shared memes, such as that of a rollercoaster ride and a baby screaming into a phone.

344.title: Everyone is doing it in Bandstand: Esha on being criticised for intimate scenes
344.article_body: Actress Esha Gupta in an interview opened up about being criticised for her intimate scenes with Bobby Deol in the web series 'Aashram 3'. "The problem is, till now in India, they think...doing intimate scenes is such a big deal, where you go in Bandstand (Mumbai) everyone is...doing it," she said, adding, "It's sad that it is all...people talk about."

345.title: Shinzo Abe's assassination videos being removed by Twitter, Meta
345.article_body: Former Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe's assassination videos are being removed by Twitter and Meta from their platforms. Meta said it was deleting videos depicting the moment of the attack and had disabled the suspect's Facebook and Instagram accounts. Twitter said its teams are addressing "harmful content" relating to the attack by "proactively removing" material that violates its rules.

346.title: Footage shows Russian tanks blowing up in seconds after Ukraine's airstrikes
346.article_body: Ukraine said its airborne force destroyed nine Russian tanks as their Defence Ministry shared a footage showing thick smoke rising from tanks after explosions. "Total number of the enemy's tanks destroyed will soon reach 2,000," tweeted Ukraine's Defence Ministry while sharing the video that shows the tanks blowing up in seconds. It's not clear which region the footage is from.

347.title: Petrol will vanish from India after 5 years: Nitin Gadkari
347.article_body: Road Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari has said that petrol will vanish from the country after five years. He added, "Your cars and scooters will either be on green hydrogen, ethanol flex fuel, CNG or LNG." Earlier, Gadkari had said the government is promoting ethanol produced from crop residue as an alternative for petrol and diesel.
