348.title: It's not like I had kids because I didn't have love: Karan on fatherhood
348.article_body: Speaking about being a single parent, filmmaker Karan Johar said that it's not like he had kids because he didn't have love in his life. "You'll know you want to be a parent when you're emotionally ready," he added. The filmmaker further said that many people thought parenthood was too much for him to handle because of his schedule.

349.title: Pune man tears passport pages to hide travel history from wife; held
349.article_body: A Pune-based 32-year-old man was stopped from boarding a flight to the Maldives and was arrested after officials at Mumbai International Airport found that he had reportedly torn about ten pages from his passport. According to the FIR, the man tore the pages to hide his travel history to Thailand from his wife. However, he was later released on bail.

350.title: Pune Metro extends deadline for Shivajinagar stretch to October
350.article_body: Officials of Maha Metro, which is implementing the Pune Metro Rail project, have said that they now expect to run Pune Metro up to Shivajinagar by October. This comes after officials in March had said that they were confident of running the service up to Shivajinagar from June. Officials have attributed the delay to "some hurdles".

351.title: Bengaluru police recover 5.11 kg marijuana, arrest 2 persons
351.article_body: Bengaluru's Upparpete police have arrested two persons who were allegedly involved in selling marijuana and recovered 5.11 kg of the drug, the city's DCP (West Division) Laxman B Nimbargi tweeted on Saturday. The arrests were made after the police raided the accused based on information received by them. Earlier on Thursday, the police had seized drugs worth ₹80 lakh.

352.title: You can tell actor's talent by eyes, can see party is empty: Divyenndu
352.article_body: Actor Divyenndu Sharma stated in an interview that an actor's talent can be seen in their eyes. "You can tell looking into their eyes that the party is empty, they are lost and their eyes are empty," he added. The actor further said that looking at such actors' eyes, he feels that luck plays a big role in the industry.

353.title: Wrong juror sat in Depp defamation trial, new trial should be ordered: Heard
353.article_body: Actress Amber Heard's team has stated that the verdict in the defamation trial by ex-husband Johnny Depp should be dismissed and a new trial should be ordered. They claimed a 77-year-old individual was called for duty, however, a 52-year-old with the same surname sat through the trial. The two individuals appear to live at the same address, the team stated.

354.title: Crash involving Cruise's self-driving car under probe in US
354.article_body: The US NHTSA has opened a special investigation into a recent crash involving a Cruise self-driving vehicle in California that resulted in minor injuries. The agency, however, has not specified the crash it is looking into. A Cruise car operating in driverless autonomous mode was reportedly involved in a crash on June 3 in San Francisco.

355.title: 2 arrested for assault in Faridabad after victim comes out of coma
355.article_body: Two people were held for assaulting and robbing a software engineer in Faridabad. The victim, Inder Singh (21), went into a 26-days-long coma after the assault and the arrest happened only after he narrated the incident, police said. One of the accused, Ritik Singh (21), started robbing to make up for ₹16 lakh he had stolen from his family.

356.title: India recorded highest-ever defence exports worth ₹13,000 cr in 2021-22: Govt
356.article_body: India's defence exports touched a record high of ₹13,000 crore in 2021-2022, the government said, adding that 70% contribution to the exports came from the private sector. Additional Secretary (Defence Production) Sanjay Jaju also said that the public sector accounted for the remaining 30% of India's defence exports. Defence exports increased by eight times in five years, said Jaju.

357.title: IMD issues red alert for Telangana for 2 days amid heavy rains
357.article_body: India Meteorological Department (IMD) issued a red alert for several parts of Telangana for Saturday and Sunday amid heavy rains. "Heavy to very heavy and extremely heavy rainfall of up to 20 cm...likely in the northern districts for two days," an official said. Nandipet in Nizamabad received about 20 cm of rainfall, the highest in Telangana, as of Saturday morning.

358.title: iD Fresh Food grants ESOPs worth ₹46 cr to 27 employees, including driver, helper
358.article_body: Ready-to-make packaged food startup iD Fresh Food has announced its seventh round of employee stock option plan (ESOP) tranche for its 27 employees. The  Bengaluru-based startup has granted ESOPs worth ₹46 crore to employees in the current round, including two who serve the company as driver and helper. "Our aspiration is to help create...100 crorepatis in...three years," the startup said.

359.title: 17-yr-old Pune girl falls to death from balcony of 14th-floor flat
359.article_body: A 17-year-old girl died after falling off the balcony of her 14th-floor flat in Hadapsar area of Pune, police said. The incident appeared to be a case of suicide after a preliminary probe, police added. "The reason is not clear and no suicide note has been found...She was alone at home at the time of death," an officer said.

360.title: Hindu outfits hold 'Sankalp March' in Delhi, traffic advisory issued
360.article_body: Delhi Traffic Police has issued an advisory in view of a 'Sankalp March' organised by various Hindu outfits on Saturday, against "attacks on the community". Several roads in central Delhi have been closed temporarily due to the march, reports stated. To facilitate smooth flow of traffic, only pedestrians have been allowed on at least nine important roads till 2 pm.

361.title: I'm worried about it: Manjrekar on Hardik bowling 10 overs in ODIs
361.article_body: Ex-India batter Sanjay Manjrekar said he is "worried" about Hardik Pandya bowling 10 overs in ODIs. "[ODI] cricket for an all-rounder is tough, it really takes a lot out of you...It is physically very draining," added Manjrekar. "Kapil Dev...[would]...confess that...[batting] first...[running] those hard singles and...then [coming] in to bowl another spell...was a very demanding task," he stated.

362.title: BJP wants to finish Shiv Sena: Sanjay Raut
362.article_body: Shiv Sena's Member of Parliament (MP) Sanjay Raut on Friday accused the BJP of trying to destroy Shiv Sena. "BJP doesn't want to engineer a split in the Shiv Sena, but it wants to finish the party," he said. "Till the time Shiv Sena exists, they cannot realise their dream of breaking Maharashtra into three pieces," he added.

363.title: Protestors enter Sri Lanka Presidential palace amid economic crisis; video surfaces
363.article_body: Protestors in Sri Lanka's commercial capital Colombo broke through police barricades and entered the Presidential palace on Saturday in one of the largest anti-government marches in the crisis-hit country this year. Reports earlier said that President Gotabaya Rajapaksa ran away after the protestors surrounded the palace. At least 21 people, including two policemen were injured and hospitalised.

364.title: 'Goodfellas', 'The Sopranos' actor Tony Sirico passes away at 79
364.article_body: Veteran American actor Tony Sirico, known for playing Paulie Walnuts in 'The Sopranos' and Tony Stacks in 'Goodfellas', passed away aged 79 on Friday. Sirico died at an assisted living facility in Fort Lauderdale, Florida, said his manager, Bob McGowen. Michael Imperioli, who portrayed Christopher Moltisanti on 'The Sopranos', mourned Sirico's demise, saying he will miss him forever.

365.title: Protesters ram tractor into barricades in H'yana; farmer killed, 4 hurt
365.article_body: A farmer was killed and four others, including three policemen, were injured after protesters allegedly rammed a tractor into the barricades outside Rajiv Gandhi Thermal Power Plant in Haryana's Hisar. The protesters, who've been staging a dharna for several weeks, demanded that the power plant shouldn't auction the fly ash it generates but rather give it to them as before.

366.title: Anthony Mackie-starrer 'Captain America 4' to be helmed by Julius Onah
366.article_body: The upcoming Anthony Mackie-starrer 'Captain America 4' will be directed by Julius Onah, known for 'The Girl is in Trouble' and 'The Cloverfield Paradox'. Malcolm Spellman, writer of 'The Falcon and the Winter Soldier', is writing the screenplay with Dalan Musson. Marvel Studios is expected to announce the release date of 'Captain America 4' at San Diego Comic-Con this month.

367.title: It wasn't pleasant to see the whole stadium cheering for Norrie: Novak
367.article_body: Discussing his win against Cameron Norrie in the Wimbledon 2022 men's singles semi-final, Novak Djokovic said, "It's never pleasant to have the whole stadium cheering for your opponent." "I sat down, wasn't...feeling well, but somehow...managed to turn the match around....It was not easy to close out the match...I felt a lot of pressure to serve it out," he added.

368.title: WWE founder paid ₹95 cr to 4 women to keep quiet about his sexual misconduct: Reports
368.article_body: WWE founder Vince McMahon paid more than $12 million (over ₹95 crore) to four different women to suppress allegations of sexual misconduct and infidelity, reports stated. One of the four women was an ex-WWE wrestler, who alleged that McMahon had coerced her into giving him oral sex and then demoted her, the reports added. WWE's board is investigating the allegations.

369.title: I am the outcast among Australian players: Wimbledon finalist Kyrgios
369.article_body: Australian tennis player Nick Kyrgios, who's reached the final of Wimbledon 2022, said he is the outcast among the Australian tennis players. "The...only great [Australian tennis player who's]...ever been supportive...[is] Lleyton Hewitt," added Kyrgios. Talking about being termed Wimbledon's "worst nightmare" in an article, Kyrgios stated, "It's hard. It's something that I have to deal with."

370.title: Govt standing behind private sector as partner in progress: PM Modi
370.article_body: Speaking at the first 'Arun Jaitley Memorial Lecture' in Delhi, PM Narendra Modi said that the government is standing behind the private sector as a partner in progress. "Today, India is one of the most reliable and state-of-the-art space service providers in the world. Our private sector ecosystem is doing a great job in this area," PM Modi added.

371.title: I am only as old as you think I am: Mahindra after Twitter user asks his age
371.article_body: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra on Saturday responded to a Twitter user who asked him his age. Mahindra wrote, "You could've found out via Google, so I suppose this is a philosophical question. In that spirit, my answer is that 'Age (like beauty) lies in the eyes of the beholder', so I'm only as old as you think I am."

372.title: Delhi man dies after assault; 1 killed in encounter; 3 arrested
372.article_body: A Delhi resident succumbed to his injuries sustained during an attack by five-six people in the city. The police arrested three people while one of the accused, Aakash (23), was shot dead during an encounter with the police in Delhi's New Usmanpur area. The other accused are identified as Vishal Negi (25), Monu (20) and Nikhil Dutt (19), police said.

373.title: Man arrested for smuggling gold worth ₹1.2 cr in suitcase rods in Hyderabad
373.article_body: A male passenger arriving from Dubai was arrested by customs officials at Rajiv Gandhi International Airport in Hyderabad for allegedly smuggling gold worth ₹1.2 crore. According to officials, the accused tried to smuggle 2,290 grams of gold by concealing it in his suitcase's rods. He was arrested on Friday and sent to judicial custody.

374.title: Sri Lanka President runs away as protestors surround his residence: Reports
374.article_body: Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa ran away after protestors surrounded his residence amid the economic crisis in the country. Protestors are demanding the resignation of Rajapaksa. Troops used tear gas and water cannons to push back demonstrators who breached the security barricades near the Presidential palace in the capital Colombo.

375.title: 4 arrested for robbing ₹56,000 from financial company in Delhi
375.article_body: Police arrested four men for allegedly robbing ₹56,000 from a non-banking financial company in Delhi's Preet Vihar area, police said. The accused also tried to rob gold articles but the branch manager pressed the security remote, which was kept in his pocket, police added. The accused fled from the spot after the security alarm started ringing loudly, police further said.

376.title: Rajnath Singh to launch 75 newly-made AI-enabled defence products
376.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh will inaugurate the first-ever 'Artificial Intelligence in Defence' symposium and exhibition, by the Department of Defence Production, Ministry of Defence, on July 11. He will be launching 75 newly-developed defence products powered by AI at the event. The products are in the domains of robotics systems, intelligent monitoring system and cybersecurity, among others.

377.title: India to tour Aus twice in 2024-32 FTP cycle; Tests increased to 5: Reports
377.article_body: The Indian cricket team is reportedly going to tour Australia twice in the upcoming 2024-2032 Future Tours Programme (FTP) cycle. According to reports, a five-match Test series will be held between the two nations in Australia instead of four. Notably, the reports claimed that Cricket Australia is expected to earn up to AU$300 million with the increase in matches.

378.title: Question is who'll Pant replace? Kishan or Karthik?: RP Singh on 2nd T20I
378.article_body: Discussing India's lineup for the second T20I against England, ex-India pacer RP Singh said, "The question is who'll Rishabh Pant replace? Ishan Kishan or Dinesh Karthik?" Virat Kohli, Jasprit Bumrah, Ravindra Jadeja and Pant didn't feature in the opening T20I but will be available for the remaining T20Is. However, Zaheer Khan said he doesn't expect any changes in the lineup.

379.title: US Senator Warren calls for universal device chargers to reduce e-waste
379.article_body: US Senator Elizabeth Warren called for US to follow EU in standardising universal chargers for devices to reduce e-waste. In a letter to US' Commerce Secretary Gina Raimondo, Warren and two other senators highlighted how chargers account for 11,000 tons of e-waste annually. "We can clear things up with uniform standards...for less expense, less hassle, and less waste," Warren tweeted.

380.title: 35-yr-old man lynched for allegedly stealing iron rods in Odisha
380.article_body: A 35-year-old man was allegedly lynched for stealing iron rods from a villager's prawn enclosure in Odisha's Balasore. According to police, the deceased had admitted to the theft when confronted and begged forgiveness. He had also returned the stolen rods to the owner. But he was tied to a tree in kangaroo court headed by the village sarpanch and assaulted.

381.title: Rohini Bhatia, wife of IndiGo Co-founder Rahul Bhatia, quits board
381.article_body: InterGlobe Aviation, the operator of IndiGo airline, said that Rohini Bhatia will resign from the board of directors of the company, with effect from July 11, 2022. Rohini is the wife of IndiGo Co-founder Rahul Bhatia and she is the Chairperson of the CSR committee of the company.  She had joined the board in 2019.

382.title: Ford recalls 100,000 vehicles in US over potential fire hazard
382.article_body: Automobile manufacturer Ford has recalled 100,000 vehicles in the US over potential fire risks. The recall covers certain 2020-2022 units of Ford Escape, Maverick and Lincoln Corsair with hybrid engines that can catch fire in case of an engine failure, the company said. However, it added that the issue has caused no accidents or injuries so far.

383.title: SBI to open 1st exclusive branch for start-ups in Bengaluru
383.article_body: The State Bank of India (SBI) and Karnataka Digital Economy Mission (KDEM) have signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU), which would enable SBI to open India's first dedicated branch for startups. The facility called the 'SBI Startup Hub' branch will be located at Koramangala in Bengaluru. SBI will offer collateral-free financial assistance of up to ₹2 crore to start-up entrepreneurs.

384.title: 3 minor boys gangrape 15-year-old girl in Tamil Nadu, blackmail her with video
384.article_body: The police in Tamil Nadu's Cuddalore has taken three minor boys into custody and booked them under POCSO Act for allegedly gangraping a 15-year-old girl. The accused also filmed the act on their mobile phones and threatened to circulate the clip if she revealed the incident to anyone. As per police, the juveniles circulated the clip to the victim's friend.

385.title: TIME magazine cover features Shinzo Abe
385.article_body: TIME magazine has unveiled the cover of its upcoming edition featuring former Japan PM Shinzo Abe who was assassinated during a speech in the Nara city. "Abe will be remembered for remaking Japan," TIME magazine said. After he was declared dead, medical officials said Abe was bleeding profusely and doctors couldn't stop the bleeding.

386.title: Adani Group to participate in 5G spectrum auction; to face Jio, Airtel: Report
386.article_body: The Adani Group has reportedly applied for participating in India’s first auction of 5G airwaves starting July 26. Three telecom operators- Reliance Jio, Bharti Airtel and Vodafone Idea have submitted their applications while Adani's participation is yet to be independently confirmed. A total of 72,097.85 MHz of spectrum worth at least ₹4.3 lakh crore will be put for auction.

387.title: It was unfair, strange: Ribéry on Ronaldo winning 2013 Ballon d'Or over him
387.article_body: Talking about Cristiano Ronaldo winning the Ballon d'Or in 2013 with him finishing third, French winger Franck Ribéry said, "It was unfair...I [should've] won it." "They extended the time for votes and something strange happened...It was a political choice," added Ribéry. "It was a difficult period, it was incomprehensible...For me, it was like a robbery," Ribéry had earlier stated.

388.title: Fire brigade rescues 6 people after part of house collapses in Pune
388.article_body: Fire brigade personnel rescued six residents of Karande Wada in Pune's Shukrawar Peth after a portion of a house collapsed on Saturday. A fire officer said that the structure is "80 to 90 years old", adding, "We suspect that incessant rains and...already dilapidated condition led to...collapse of this part." PMC's building department will inspect the structure, fire brigade officials said.

389.title: Red alert issued for 7 districts in K'taka amid heavy rains; 12 dead since June 1
389.article_body: Amid heavy rains, India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a red alert for Karnataka's Dakshina Kannada, Uttara Kannada, Udupi, Chikkamagaluru, Shivamogga, Kodagu and Hassan districts. CM Basavaraj Bommai on Friday said a total of 12 people have lost their lives so far in various rain-related incidents since June 1. Karnataka has received 94% excess rain during July, according to IMD.

390.title: Be careful about period-tracking apps: WH official after abortion ruling
390.article_body: Director of the White House's Gender Policy Council Jen Klein has said that people in the US should be "really careful" about using period-tracking apps following the Supreme Court's latest ruling on abortion. She clarified the White House is not directing people to stop using the apps. Menstrual cycle tracking app Flo announced an 'anonymous mode' option last week.

391.title: It's very emotional for me: Ananya on Suhana & Shanaya's acting debuts
391.article_body: Actress Ananya Panday has said she's looking forward to seeing her best friends Shanaya Kapoor and Suhana Khan make their debut in Bollywood. "Suhana, Shanaya and I have had this collective dream of being in showbiz. Growing up, all we did together was play acting games," Ananya said, adding, "So it's very exciting for me, it's very emotional for me."

392.title: 70-yr-old woman held captive by son in bathroom for 2 yrs in K'taka, freed
392.article_body: A 70-year-old woman, who had been held captive by her son and daughter-in-law in a bathroom at their home for over two years in Karnataka's Dakshina Kannada, has been freed, as per reports. The woman fell and was injured in January 2020, following which she was held captive and was not even provided food, a Senior Citizens' Helpline official said.

393.title: Steve Smith is a 'very harsh' critic of himself: Marnus Labuschagne
393.article_body: Australia batter Marnus Labuschagne said Steve Smith is a "very harsh" critic of himself, adding that Smith's expectations are "really high". Smith once ran three kilometres back to the hotel after being dismissed cheaply. "I always punish myself when I get no runs," he had stated. Smith recently scored his 28th Test century marking his first ton in 18 months.

394.title: After being acquitted of murder, BJP leader holds roadshow in UP; booked
394.article_body: A BJP leader and his supporters were booked for allegedly holding a roadshow from Etah district jail to Aligarh in Uttar Pradesh without administration's permission. The roadshow was taken out on Thursday, a day after the BJP leader was acquitted of murdering a man during 2020 CAA-NRC protest. "There were around 30 to 35 vehicles in...procession," a police officer said.

395.title: India responded after Chinese jet came close to LAC in June: Reports
395.article_body: The Indian Air Force had responded as per the standard operating procedures after Chinese Air Force aircraft flew very close to the Line of Actual Control (LAC) in Ladakh sector in the last week of June, reports said. The aircraft was spotted by men on ground and was also picked up by radars deployed in the border area, reports added.

396.title: Sale of machine made or polyester national flag exempt from GST: Govt
396.article_body: The Finance Ministry has clarified that the sale of India's national flag, irrespective of whether it is machine-made or of polyester, is exempt from GST. Hand-woven, hand-spun national flags made of cotton, silk, wool or Khadi are already exempt from GST. After an amendment to the Flag Code of India, 2002, the tricolour can now be hand-made or machine-made.

397.title: If a top 5 batter bowls in powerplay, it's like having 12 players: Parthiv
397.article_body: Ex-India wicketkeeper Parthiv Patel said he feels that a team is playing with 12 players if there's a batter in the top five who can bowl in the powerplay. Hardik Pandya recently picked four wickets in the first T20I against England. Bhuvneshwar Kumar conceded 10 runs and picked one wicket. "When there's swing...there is none better than Bhuvneshwar," added Parthiv.

398.title: A stampede-like situation happened: Rescued Amarnath pilgrim on cloudburst
398.article_body: "A stampede-like situation happened there," said a pilgrim who was rescued from the Amarnath cave following a cloudburst. "The floods triggered by the cloudburst carried a large number of stones with it," an eyewitness said. "We all had a harrowing experience as we witnessed people and bags get swept away with the water," another rescued pilgrim added.

399.title: Boris Johnson's wax statue placed outside 'find a job' centre after he resigns as UK PM
399.article_body: A wax figure of Boris Johnson has appeared outside a 'find a job' centre after he resigned as the UK PM. Members of the public have been spotted posing for photos with the waxwork, from Madame Tussauds in Blackpool. Johnson will continue to serve as Prime Minister until the Conservative Party chooses his successor.

400.title: Messi threatens to leave PSG if the club signs Ronaldo: Reports
400.article_body: PSG forward Lionel Messi has threatened to leave PSG if the club signs Cristiano Ronaldo from Manchester United, reports stated. Messi reportedly told PSG President Nasser Al-Khelaifi that he'll return to Barcelona in case the club signs Ronaldo. Ronaldo is believed to be looking for transfer from Manchester United as the club failed to qualify for the upcoming Champions League.
